Definition: You will be given two phrases: Head and Tail, separated by <sep>. The Head and the Tail events are short phrases involving participants. The names of specific people have been replaced by generic words. PersonX is always the subject of the event. You have to determine whether, as a result of the Head, PersonX wants what is mentioned in the Tail. In this task, wanting is a postcondition desire on the part of PersonX. As a result of PersonX giving PersonY gifts, PersonX may also desire to hug PersonY. Classify your answers into "Yes" and "No". The phrase may also contain "___", a placeholder that can be an object, a person, and/or an action.
Domains: Commonsense -> Concepts and Relations -> Social Commonsense

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX arranges a date<sep>Tail: to find a nice restaurant.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. As a result of the Head, PersonX wants to find a nice restaurant.
In this example, bad is not what PersonX wants. So the output is correct.

Positive Examples.input: Head: PersonX gives PersonY bread<sep>Tail: to eat a piece of bread
Positive Examples.explanation: As a result of the Head, personX wants to eat a piece of bread. Thus, this example should be classified as "Yes".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX blesses PersonY's heart<sep>Tail: to call person y
Negative Examples.explanation: The Tail is not what PersonX wants as a result of the Head. So the output should be "No".

Negative Examples.input: Head: PersonX asks PersonY's mother<sep>Tail: to write down the solution to the problem
Negative Examples.explanation: If PersonX asks PersonY's mother; as a result, PersonX wants to write down the solution to the problem, and the output should be "Yes".

Instances.input: Head: PersonX explains PersonY's actions<sep>Tail: talk to personY about it
Head: PersonX invites several friends<sep>Tail: attend an event
Head: PersonX feels bad but<sep>Tail: to help their situation
Head: PersonX eventually got married<sep>Tail: to go on honeymoon
Head: PersonX defeats PersonX's purpose<sep>Tail: to be a better person
Head: PersonX asks PersonY to stay<sep>Tail: lonely
Head: PersonX is due today<sep>Tail: to rest
